TopicTitle: Why game not acknowledge that i fulfill contract despite i meet all requestment

Articles.Content: I was put in orbit equatorial (approx 13400 by 13400 km just above Mun orbit) satellite equipped with a thermometer, i fulfilled all requestment yet the game don't acknowledged that.
You didn't make it orbit the wrong direction by some chance, did you?

You can look at the contracts list and you will see a little green check on all the conditions for the contract that are fulfilled. Look for the one that is not checked, and you'll know what the problem is.

What mikegarrison said. And if the one thing that's not checked is "put it in the specified orbit," and you look at it and it seems right to you, then probably it's what Vlad mentioned, you're in the wrong direction (check the AN/DN markers, do they say "180 degrees"?)
It would be nice if contracts gave you some idea of just WHAT was off about your orbit, wouldn't it?

> 
> It would be nice if contracts gave you some idea of just WHAT was off about your orbit, wouldn't it?

Like the little dots that show which way to go perhaps.
No, more like letting you know your apoapsis is off, or your periapsis, or inclination, in the contract conditions area.

This looks like you sent it in the wrong direction. I do it all the time. 

Check other possible issues in your requirements tab during flight : Which ones are not green lighted ? Often the contractors require a craft designed specifically for the purpose. It's annoying but it can be source of issues. 

If all else fails, alt-F12 will open the developer tab where you'll be able to complete it. I don't recommend that option though - this is likely to be a gameplay error rather than a game bug.

Sorry guys that's was my fault, I just do not know how to read with understanding ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)

Under the conditions of the contract I read that the satellite is to have a thermometer, but I did not read that it had to have a antenna, now satellite have all that was specified in contract.

<iframe width="480" height="270" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/yLsN3tSaBJY?feature=oembed" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen="true"></iframe>
Yep, I've done that one a few times. I now put a docking port or 2 on them so I can send up anything I forget. Well unless I forget the docking ports!

My approach is to have a template rocket that is pre-built which has all the necessary stuff for a particular type of contracts (satellites, stations, etc.), and each time it's just about adding stuff - I didn't miss anything like antenna, docking port for them.

The downside is - I tend to forget more often when I'm not using templates.

Note that you can (and should) check whether your ship fulfills all the requirements regarding power, antennae and other add ons while the ship is on the launch pad.

That way if you've forgotten anything you can simply revert (or recover at no loss, if playing with no reverts) and add whatever you've forgotten.

Reverse orbits... been there, done that. Thank god for the debug menu cheats at times so that it may fix my dumb mistakes learning the ropes. ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)
